questions.question: What is the primary textual element displayed prominently on the product's surface?
Considering the visible text, what specific type of tea is mentioned as a component?
Based on the textual information, which adjective describes the tea's caffeine content?
What term precedes both 'Green Tea' and 'Lemon Myrtle' in the text, indicating a production method?
What additional organic ingredient is listed alongside the green tea in the ingredient declaration?
What descriptive word modifies 'Myrtle' in the list of components, suggesting its origin?
Considering the overall presentation, what is the most apparent physical attribute of this product?
What is the background color against which the product's text is printed?
What is the style of the font used to display the information on this item?
Observing the textual composition, what is the case of the letters used in the word 'Ingredients'?
Describe the format of the information shown: a single line, multiple lines, or paragraphs?
If we consider the text's arrangement, what would best describe the alignment?
What would best describe the overall tone and clarity of the displayed text?
Is there any apparent visual design element beyond just the text, such as images or graphics?
Considering the density of the text, is it sparse or very dense?
